title: What online sales funnel is recommended for network marketers? - Quora

response.answer_text: ClickFunnels hands down. Why ClickFunnels is the best: You can create your own money-making funnels without any coding experience or technical skillsInstead paying big bucks to wait on developers to create your funnels you can create them yourselfAlong with sales funnels you can also generate leads, make sales, one-click upsells, webinars and everything else you need to succeed onlineClickFunnels is your page editor, shopping cart and membership site all in oneSpeaking of the page editor, it is a simple ‘drag n drop’ editor that makes it simple for anyone to quickly and easily design pages that convert leads to salesInstead of using standard email autoresponders that don’t interact with your funnels, Actionetics is fully-integrated with ClickFunnels. Actionetics allows you to create virtual smart lists that send messages directly to your prospects and customers, based on the actions they take as they travel through your funnelsPlus of the biggest advantages of using ClickFunnels is the infamous “share funnel” feature which allows you to very easily duplicate an entire funnel into your account from someone else’s account. Yes, you heard that right. The share funnel feature truly makes ClickFunnels a community of like-minded entrepreneurs who are interested in your success. The share funnels used to be difficult to find but recently the ClickFunnel team has assembled them all in one place on their blog. The value on all these share funnels is simply priceless. What’s more? These shared funnels will be constantly updated as they’re created and shared on the Facebook group and other ClickFunnels community areas. More

A simple sales funnel is nothing more than a page or site that has the key word used by a search included within it. And, it can give all the features and benefits on the landing page. This page then has a call to action such as an order form or direct link to the payment processor. Sometimes, the landing page’s call to action is an opportunity to click a button to get more information. And, then there is another call to action for the order. Complicated funnels will get into the “else then” coding techniques where the user is faced with a yes/no type of question. Then whichever choice they select takes them down a path that gets to the order after answering their concerns. These yes/no type questions can be scattered throughout the user experience and like a great funnel, they eventually get to the order. An example of the yes/no type question is a button that says buy-me and another that says Not yet, I need more information. These “I need more information” buttons often have multiple choices of information types. like: (X) Show me the specs, (X) What additional Benefits, (X) What choices of colors, etc Every page has a junction which includes the choice to buy now or an alternative. Some will end the funnel with the only option is buy now.
